alert.note: Alert for Lewis (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 10 at 2:52AM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Shoshone, Nez Perce, and Lewis counties in northern Idaho. * WHEN...From late tonight through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations, including on and near burn scars. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Several rounds of rain are expected in northern Idaho through Monday. By Monday afternoon, widespread 1 to 3 inch rainfall totals are anticipated. These rainfall totals may lead to localized flooding, especially in areas where heavier rainfall rates are observed. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
